com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface WindowsInfoConnection

public interface WindowsInfoConnection

A connection that can be used to gather information about Windows machines. Connections are not thread safe due to potential interactions with the COM threading model. Once established a connection, queries, and result sets must only be accessed by the thread that originally opened the connection. Attempts at accessing a WindowsInfo instance from another thread will cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown.

Method Detail

buildQuery

WindowsInfoQuery buildQuery(java.lang.String query,
                            long timeoutMillis)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Executes a WMI-style query. This connection can be created using either WinRM or WMI so queries passed to it should be written so that they will work using both technologies. Most standard queries work transparently, but queries that access class meta-data (of the form SELECT * FROM meta_class WHERE __Class = "...") will not work when executed using WinRM. In rare situations where platform-specific queries must be executed, agents can invoke getConnectionType() to determine which underlying subsystem they are connected to.

Agents must only execute methods on this connection from within the thread where the connection was established, to avoid cross-thread issues related to COM. In general, this isn't a problem so long as agents execute queries as soon as the connection is established: 

 void collectData() throws ... {
     WindowsInfoConnection connection = mConnectionService.establish( ... );
     try {
         collectSomeData( connection );
     }
     finally {
         mConnectionService.release( connection );
     }
 }

 void collectSomeData(WindowsInfoConnection connection) {
     WindowsInfoQuery results = connection.buildQuery( "...", timeout );
     for ( WindowsInfoObject result : results ) {
       // handle this result
     }
     results.close();
 }
Agent developers are strongly encouraged to ensure their agents are tested against both WinRM and WMI information services to be sure that their queries, and result processing are compatible with both services.

Parameters:
query - The query string to execute
timeoutMillis - The number of milliseconds to wait before timing out, or 0 to disable timeouts entirely
Returns:
A query that can be executed to retrieve data from the remote system
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - A thread other than this connection's creator called this method
See Also:
WindowsInfoQuery

executeMethod

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> executeMethod(java.lang.String objectType,
                                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> objectIdentity,
                                                               java.lang.String methodName,
                                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> methodParameters,
                                                               long timeout)
                                                               throws ConnectionBrokenException,
                                                                      java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                                                      java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                                      java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                                                      QueryFailedException
Executes a method on the object identified by objectIdentity. All of the method's return values will be stored in a Map and passed along to the agent for processing. If the method did not return anything then an empty map will be returned instead of null.

Not all methods require parameters. Passing null or an empty set for methodParameters is acceptable.

Parameters:
objectType - The type of object to invoke methodName on
objectIdentity - The collection of properties that uniquely identify the target object
methodName - The name of the method to invoke on the currently selected object
methodParameters - The name->value pairs for parameters included in the method call or null
timeout - The amount of time to wait for the operation to complete
Returns:
The name->value mapping of all the values returned by this method
Throws:
ConnectionBrokenException - The method call was not completed successfully
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - The method call did not execute on time
java.lang.InterruptedException - This thread was interrupted before the method call could be completed
java.lang.IllegalStateException - A thread other than this connection's creator called this method
QueryFailedException - The remote service has indicated that query cannot be completed

getArchitecture

java.lang.String getArchitecture(long timeoutMillis)
                                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
Tries to guess the canonical architecture type of the remote system. This is a convenience method that constructs and executes an appropriate query on the agent's behalf. The architecture is that of the underlying CPU, not that of the OS (for historical reasons) so this may return x86_64 for 32-bit version of Windows installed on a 64-bit chip.

If the architecture type cannot be determined this method will return unknown. It will never return null.

Parameters:
timeoutMillis - The number of milliseconds to wait before failing
Returns:
The results of SELECT Architecture FROM Win32_Processor mapped into Quest's canonical operating system type
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - This thread was interrupted before the query could complete
java.lang.IllegalStateException - A thread other than this connection's creator called this method
See Also:
CanonicalNameService.getArchitecture(String arch)

getCommonTopologyProvider

CommonTopologyInfo getCommonTopologyProvider()
                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                    java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                                    java.lang.InterruptedException
Obtains an instance of the CommonTopologyInfo class that will return values for the remote system that can be used to population the common Host topology model. This includes the Host and OperatingSystem topology objects.

Returns:
A common topology object that contains the correct values to use for creating topology objects for the remote system.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
java.io.IOException
Since:
5.6.7

getConnectionParameters

WindowsInfoConnectionParameters getConnectionParameters()
Returns the agent-defined parameters that were used to create this connection.

Returns:
The parameters used to open this connection

getConnectionType

WindowsInfoConnectionType getConnectionType()
Returns the type of windows information service this connection communicates with. The majority of the code written for an agent should be usable transparently with both WinRM and WMI connections. However, there are occasional situations where a query will work on only one server or the other. In cases like this writing type-specific queries will avoid an unnecessary try/catch block that could eat exceptions and mask real underlying problems.

Returns:
The type of information service this is connected to

getHostName

java.lang.String getHostName(long timeoutMillis)
                             throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                    java.lang.IllegalStateException
Attempts to return the canonical host name for this machine. This is a convenience method that constructs and executes a query on the agent's behalf.

If the target system is unable to report its own hostname then this method will return the identifier used by the agent to establish a connection. This method will never return null.

Parameters:
timeoutMillis - The number of milliseconds to wait before failing
Returns:
The hostname used to identify the target system
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - This thread was interrupted before the query could complete
java.lang.IllegalStateException - A thread other than this connection's creator called this method

getOperatingSystemType

java.lang.String getOperatingSystemType(long timeoutMillis)
                                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                               java.lang.IllegalStateException
Returns the canonical operating system type. This method will typically return windows since the information services it connects to are almost exclusive to that operating system.

If the operating system type cannot be determined then unknown will be returned. This method will never return null.

Parameters:
timeoutMillis - The number of milliseconds to wait before failing
Returns:
The canonical operating system name
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - This thread was interrupted before the query could complete
java.lang.IllegalStateException - A thread other than this connection's creator called this method
See Also:
CanonicalNameService.getOperatingSystemType(String name)
